edu.neu.csye6200.model

Interface CrudDao<T extends DBObject>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - A placeholder for the data model class later to be specified
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ParentDao, StudentDao

    public interface CrudDao<T extends DBObject>
    CRUD DAO, a generic DAO class for all DBObject subclass
    How to use:
     
 // Let's say you have a subclass of CrudDao called PeopleDao:
 (remember to add @RegisterBeanMapper(People.class) annotation on your Dao)
 public interface PeopleDao extends CrudDao<People>
 {
 }

 // then:
 PeopleDao dao = DatabaseManager.getDB().onDemand(PeopleDao.class);
 // then you can call all base methods declared in <CrudDao>, like:
 dao.createTable("people", "id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY");
 // but most of the time you don't need to hard code SQL queries, as you can use <SQLUtils>:
 dao.createTable(SQLUtils.getTableName(People.class), SQLUtils.getProperties(People.class));
    Author:
    Haotian Zheng
    See Also:
    DBObject, DatabaseTableModel

    • Method Detail

      • createTable

        void createTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                 java.lang.String sql)
        Create a table in database if it does not exist
        Parameters:
        tableName - table name, usually acquired via SQLUtils.getTableName(YourDataModel.class)
        sql - sql query for table properties, also with a helper method SQLUtils.getProperties(YourDataModel.class)

      • insert

        void insert(java.lang.String tableName,
            java.lang.String keysAndValues)
        Insert an entry into the database
        Parameters:
        tableName - table name, usually acquired via SQLUtils.getTableName(YourDataModel.class)
        keysAndValues - usually acquired via SQLUtils.getKeysAndValues(model, false)
